column4: You were telling me the options for ICS were there as described in documentation.  I don't see them: http://imgur.com/LmuWJ.png
what about eth1??
the one you edit to share internet with is eth1
Exactly the same pciture.
hmm doesnt add up
Shall I screenshot that?
nah if it's not there I believe you

So I've set up eth1 manually, entered an ip address, etc, and when I connect that using the network icon in the top right, it boots me off the internet on eth0, but definately put sme on the lan ( ican ping other machines).
that's because you cant use both at the same time
why not?
ok you can, but default is you connect one the other disconnects and vice versa
okay, so where to go from here?
did you try adding it manually?
adding what manually?
I wouldn't know where to begin.
yes and like this too  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Internet/ConnectionSharing?action=show&redirect=InternetConnectionSharing
I'l give it a try, though obviously I was disinspired to trust the sadvice there after it refered to things which wern't there ;->
the reason I told you I setup a small box to share internet with xbox and it's there, I'm not at that pc at the moment and it was all point and click
sudo gedit /etc/rc.local
after following those instructions, shoudl I need to reboot, or anything like that?
yes
Never mind, it worked!  Thanks for all the help, you and everyone else.
heh even better
